column1: Uchi////The food here is very good. I enjoyed it thoroughly and would highly recommend it to anyone. That being said
column2: across several dishes -- including cold and hot small plates
column5: and maki -- I thought many of the secondary and tertiary flavors overpowered the flavor of the protein (the wagyu hot rock excluded). These flavors weren't bad. In fact
column6: they were very tasty. But as someone who tends to be a purist when it comes to things like sushi
column7: I found some of these flavors masked or altered the natural nuances of the fish. The fish should speak for itself
column8: not be silenced by preparations that are trying too hard -- even if those preparations are enjoyable. Nevertheless
column9: I'll definitely return to Uchi and would recommend it to anyone who asks.
